{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3488529,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T22:41:31.004Z","cooked":"

How do I install the 2025 libraries onto my raspberry pi? the latest release of wpilibpi seems to be a 2024 beta: Releases · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub

I only really need it for the 2025 apriltag field, which I think I can get from a json I upload myself, but it’d be nice to have it installed with python and so on.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T22:41:31.004Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":115,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":615.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/WPILibPi/releases","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Releases · wpilibsuite/WPILibPi · GitHub","clicks":12}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/1","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3488645,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T01:14:15.055Z","cooked":"

Do you actually need to run WPILib code on the Romi itself? You can run 2025 robot code with the older Romi image.

To answer your question directly: no, there’s no supported way of doing that without building it yourself (the 2023 image runs an older version of the OS and our 2025 pre-built binaries won’t run on it).

Are you deprecating the raspberry wpilibpi images? We have been using them for the camera server / network tables / april tag libraries on the pi coprocessor for years.

No, but I’ve so far stalled out on finishing the update of the wpilibpi image to bookworm, which is what’s needed to keep pace with WPILib. The OS upgrade breaks the web interface for network settings (due to a change to NetworkManager) and a few other things.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T05:53:15.060Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32094,"username":"CJ_Hill","name":"CJ Hill","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cj_hill/{size}/142363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/5","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3488841,"name":"billjester3","username":"billjester3","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T13:06:25.106Z","cooked":"

If it’s helpful, I put together a step by step tutorial for our programming students to build their own AprilTag vision processor from scratch on a Raspberry Pi 5. We used WPILibPi and PhotonVision in past seasons but decided to DIY this year so our students had a better learning experience and we had more control over the behavior of the tool.

A few things might still refer to pre-kickoff code, but it should be relatively up to date.

That is a very nice demo. Thank your for sharing it!

Good luck, and let me know if you have any feedback if you use any of the tutorials.

In theory our team should have alignment based on this code working on our practice bot tonight. I’ll update the tutorial if we make any changes to our workflow.

Nice tutorials. Using the WPILib AprilTag example and WPILib math I have a Java program to compute the pose similar to your Python program. It didn’t work on the last WPILibPi image as there are a couple of so missing. Any chance your RPi installation for Python would also work for Java programs?

I opened a PR to update the WPILibPi bookworm image to 2025.2.1, but bookworm is still broken/needs testing in a few places.

I’m decently positive that bookworm still contains older versions of NetworkManager; what version specifically introduced that breakage?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T14:33:39.318Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":20.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/11","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491584,"name":"billjester3","username":"billjester3","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T14:43:18.637Z","cooked":"

I don’t see why it wouldn’t work with Java, you would just need to work through sourcing all of the libraries. We chose Python for the simplicity of library management and to leverage some diversity in the language preference of our programming team (i.e. the coprocessor team is doing Python work on the pi while the core robot team is writing Java for the Rio).

I am working with the team right now to update settings on both the UsbCamera and the AprilTagDetector, as our detection range with the code as published is lousy. Anyone following our examples should be aware of this. I will try to update the tutorial once we have this dialed in.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T14:43:18.637Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"billjester3","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491596,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T14:54:44.835Z","cooked":"

I don’t think the previous version of Pi OS used NetworkManager, or if it did, it used different configuration files? The current web config logic writes directly to text configuration files for dhcpcd, wpa_supplicant, dnsmasq, and hostapd, restarts those processes as necessary using systemctl, and doesn’t talk to NetworkManager at all. Maybe NetworkManager can simply be disabled so this approach still works?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T14:57:27.221Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/13","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491606,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T15:08:10.387Z","cooked":"
Peter_Johnson:

Maybe NetworkManager can simply be disabled so this approach still works

Neither SystemD nor Debian require you to use NetworkManager, to my knowledge; Gentoo’s netifrc stack has done the other approach for God-knows-how-long with no breakages. You might have to manually install wpa_supplicant because it may have been removed from the default packageset? Regardless the other approach works just fine.

billjester3:

detection range with the code as published is lousy

I just tested ArduCam1280x800 OV9281_USB_Camera and the detection range was excellent. The 3d pose is solid out to about 2 meters but too jumpy for 3d pose past about 2 meters (maybe that’s what you meant).

For servoing mode it goes out a long ways as the tag barely moves in the camera frame. Also, I might not have calibrated the camera the best. Could try to do better.

There was a lot of flicker from the school room lights and I don’t know if that caused some of the jumpy poses. I don’t see an option for 50hz or 60hz flicker reduction on the camera settings.

My Java code might be okay for zero $ budget teams as it will run on a roboRIO v2. If a team goes to the effort of getting an RPi why not use PV?

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T17:46:09.708Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":12,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":34,"readers_count":33,"score":16.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/15","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491799,"name":"billjester3","username":"billjester3","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/439d5e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T18:24:02.276Z","cooked":"

That’s the camera we’re using, and we’re definitely suffering from flicker from overhead LED lighting. What resolution were you running, what FPS did you get, and did you change any of the AprilTag detector settings (decimation, etc.)? Also, can you clarify “Servoing mode”?

Re: just using PhotonVision, we’ve done that the last few years. It’s generally worked well, but we were bit by some of the “settings not sticking” bugs. More importantly, our students didn’t actually learn much about vision processing since it was plug and play. So writing our own vision code is a priority since it aligns better with our core values and will (hopefully) give us a robust solution – any bugs are ours to fix!

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T18:24:02.276Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":11.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482799,"topic_slug":"2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi","display_username":"billjester3","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24594,"username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31586,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2025-libraries-on-wpilibpi/482799/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3492038,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T23:02:39.581Z","cooked":"

I am computing the 3d pose at about 60 fps on my laptop in simulation mode. I don’t have a roboRIO at the moment to check. It takes most of the CPU of a roboRIO v1 - not much time left for many robot commands.

I don’t know the fps for decoding the AprilTag - it could be higher and I didn’t track how many, if any, frames are discarded because the pose calculation was too busy to get an available frame.

“Servoing” mode is LL nomenclature for the one-dimensional pose of the AprilTag in the camera horizontal axis - the same as we did for the retroreflective tape; scan back and forth to align the camera (robot) to the marked target.

This is what I used for camera calibration:

        case ArduCam1280x800:// Arducam_OV9281_USB_Camera_(A?); Cameron board 1280x800      
          cameraW = 1280;
          cameraH = 800;
          fps = 100;
          cameraFx = 907.6920444758049;
          cameraFy = 907.1513951038395;
          cameraCx = 604.1750223777503;
          cameraCy = 416.4609913313957;
          distortionCoeffs = new MatOfDouble(
            0.040354289830866516, -0.044066115475547216, 6.662818829158613E-4,9.755603732755772E-4,  // k1 k2 p1 p2
              -0.013630390510289322, // k3
              -0.0011985508423857224, 0.003370423168524356, 0.0010337869630847195); // k4 k5 k6
              // assume s1 s2 s3 s4 tx ty are all zeros
          break;
